This Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Japan.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the governing law clause to the end of the 'Effectiveness' section obscures its importance and may cause confusion as to whether it applies if the agreement terminates early.
perturbation.law_citation: Restatement (Second) of Conflict of Laws ยง 187
perturbation.law_explanation: The Restatement emphasizes that a choice-of-law clause should be clear and conspicuous. Burying it within a section on the agreement's effectiveness undermines its clarity and enforceability, potentially leading a court to question whether the parties truly intended for Japanese law to govern all aspects of the agreement, especially if the agreement terminates early.

perturbation.original_text: Article 4.Effectiveness This Amendment shall only become effective upon the VNBJ Closing with respect to Article 1.1 and the VNBZ Closing with respect to Article 1.2, and shall terminate without any force or effect in the event that the VNBJ SPA and the VNBZ SPA are terminated in accordance with the terms thereof.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 2.D&O Indemnity Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.

Article 4.Effectiveness This Amendment shall only become effective upon the VNBJ Closing with respect to Article 1.1 and the VNBZ Closing with respect to Article 1.2, and shall terminate without any force or effect in the event that the VNBJ SPA and the VNBZ SPA are terminated in accordance with the terms thereof.

Article 2.D&O Indemnity Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.explanation: Duplicating Article 2 makes the contract confusing. The second instance of the article may not be read due to the first one's existance, and if it is read it may make it appear that the parties had some disagreement during drafting.
perturbation.law_explanation: Duplicating Article 2 introduces ambiguity into the contract. Section 202 of the Restatement (Second) of Contracts states that a contract's language should be interpreted in context. The duplication creates conflicting interpretations: one article applies to Directors and Officers and the second Article applies to...? This redundancy creates uncertainty, contravening the principle of clear and consistent contract interpretation.
